text:
When Labor Day comes around each year, it's a sign that summer is unfortunately coming to a close. All your faves still managed to turn up and enjoy the last real weekend of summer and the last opportunity to wear white. Hip-hop's heavyweights were out in full force at Philadelphia's Made in America Festival over the weekend, with some incredibly strong steez to match. Check out how your favorite celebrities, athletes, and musicians celebrated their Labor Day weekend below.

Pusha T rocks "hobo couture" onstage at Made in America Festival.

Meek Mill, 21 Savage, and Joel "The Process" Embiid link up backstage.

Vic Mensa keeps it punk.

Vic looking like J. Cole's rebellious cousin.

JAY-Z keeps it cozy onstage.

Young B and the ROC off-duty.

Off-duty birthday girl Bey rocking some OFF-WHITE.

Quavo's got his middle fingers in the air, like he just don't care.

Cardi B and Beyoncé finally link up.

Partynextdoor hangs out somewhere “way way past The Valley.”

Ariana tours Down Under.

The Weeknd kicks back at home with some jams...

...and later dines with his boo Selena Gomez.

Father stays indoors.

Khalid hits the stage in Vegas with Marshmello.

Swae Lee enjoys some self-inflicted pleasure.

Future gets that Wall Street money...

...and rolls deep Uptown to Spanish Harlem.

Migos are certified gold.

Rich Chigga kicks it back home.

Floyd Mayweather takes a well-deserved break and uses his last opportunity of the year to wear white.

Kaytranada was on his grind despite the holiday.

Em Rata celebrated early in a red-hot bikini.

The Kardashians took it poolside.

Kali Uchis delivers an important message from her bed.

Pharrell keeps it germ-free in Japan.

Paris Hilton feels the love at Burning Man.

Revisit what celebrities were up to on July 4th this year right here.
title: Here's How Your Favorite Celebrities Celebrated Labor Day Weekend
